intro: Achneria hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy achneria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. Achneria hirsuta is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
